title: Junior Data Engineer
description:
Description Our growing organization is looking for a  Junior Data Engineer  to join our growing team of software engineers. Does working with Python, Apache Spark, Apache Cassandra, Apache Pulsar, CockroachDB and other current Big Data technologies sound exciting to you? iland’s Junior Data Engineer will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross-functional teams. The ideal candidate is someone excited about building data pipelines, wrangling data, and optimizing data systems. This person will support our software developers, database architects, and data analysts on data initiatives and will ensure optimal delivery and consistent architecture throughout ongoing projects. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing and influencing the direction of our company’s data architecture aimed at supporting our next generation of products and data initiatives. Join our global team of software developers as a Junior Data Engineer and contribute to development of the industry-leading 11:11 Cloud Console (https://1111systems.com/why-1111/cloud-console ), among other exciting projects. This is only the beginning of what will surely be your most challenging and rewarding role to date. Work with the latest technologies and push the barriers, all while helping build dynamic software that will have a lasting effect on the industry. Responsibilities Take an idea from design concept to working implementation that will be deployed for both internal and external use Build elegant, clean, bulletproof code that is driven by tests Work with Software Engineering to ensure architectural and implementation coherence Debug issues and develop quick, robust solutions to keep systems running smoothly Participate in code reviews to ensure alignment with the architectural approach and to maintain a clean code base Requirements   Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent Strong interpersonal and communication skills is essential Flexibility, energy, and ability to work well with others in a team environment Must have skills include: 1+ years of Python experience 1+ year(s) of Data Engineering experience Strong Understanding of SQL and NoSQL databases Git CI/CD Linux Nice to have skills include: Experience with Apache Spark or other DataFrame-like frameworks Experience with Apache Cassandra Open-source project contributions GitHub or public-facing source code Developer forum (Stack Overflow, etc.) participation Benefits Competitive Salary 401k Plan with Company Match PPO Healthcare Insurance Plan Dental Insurance Vision Insurance Life Insurance Paid Vacation & Holidays About 11:11 Systems 11:11 Systems was created to deliver a fully integrated and unified network experience, providing our customers with visibility, control, and decision making to simplify their requirements through one experience: simplified, synchronized, and optimized. 11:11 is invested in creating a new model empowering its customers and partners to “RETHINK CONNECTED”. Fully integrated, fully automated. All services, all activities, all data, all performance, powered on a single platform.

title: Software Engineer I (Intern) United States
description:
What You’ll Do Our software engineers are the gurus behind the scenes ensuring our all of our programs are easy to use and bug free. Using a keen eye, you’ll develop software and tools in support of many of our high-impact technology platforms such as operating systems, networks, databases and more. While we’re growing in the software business, you’ll still need to see the big picture and watch for hardware compatibility while even potentially influencing design. Who You’ll Work With Our hardworking team members are busy programming magic across the globe on teams such as Engineering, Information Technology, Supply Chain, Customer Experience, Security and Trust, etc. You would play a crucial role in driving next-gen software innovations including cloud, mobile, desktop or security spaces. On any of these teams, you'll get hands-on experience working with applications that make technology accessible no matter what device they’re on. See the possibilities when creativity meets design and build solutions which will transform how we work, live, learn, and play. Who You Are  Including but not limited to an upcoming graduate of a technical degree or certification program from a Technical Boot Camp, Apprenticeship, Community College or 4-Year University.   Up-to-date on programming and scripting languages: C/C++, Python, Java   Knowledge of Linux, Networking concepts, OS fundamentals, Embedded Development, and/or ML   Hands on QA, Testing, and/or Debugging skills   Experience with Databases, Web Application Development, and Web Services   Able to legally live and work in the country for which you’re applying, without visa support or sponsorship  Why Cisco #WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all. We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box! But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.) Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward. So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

title: IT Systems Assistant/Helpdesk
description:
Job Description Our client is seeking an experienced Help Desk/IT Support professional to join their team! This individual will be responsible for supporting end users and maintaining the company's IT systems including troubleshooting, installation, setup, and management of hardware, software, networking, and peripherals, as well as some basic user training. This is a contract-to-hire position which will begin onsite in Golden Valley during a 3-month training and onboarding period and move to hybrid with 3 days per week onsite. Responsibilities Provide onsite and remote help desk support for internal end users Deploy, set up, and maintain desktops, software, phones, printers, etc. Manage IT inventory, providing tracking and organization Provide documentation for technology and processes Manage Active Directory alongside other members of IT team Preferred Experience 2+ years in prior IT experience required Office 365 programs Infrastructure including Windows servers, virtual machines, and SQL Server Network hardware, protocols, and services Windows OS and iOS for mobile devices Cloud-based software Shell scripting or other scripting languages Cyber security Pursuit or completion of a Bachelor's in Information Technology or related field We are an equal opportunity employer and make hiring decisions based on merit. Recruitment, hiring, training, and job assignments are made without regard to race, color, national origin, age, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, disability, or any other protected classification. We consider all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. To apply please email your resume to mpieper@ledgent.com

title: Software Engineering Intern
description:
It takes powerful technology to connect our brands and partners with an audience of nearly 900 million. Whether you’re looking to write mobile app code, engineer the servers behind our massive ad tech stacks, or develop algorithms to help us process trillions of data points a day, what you do here will have a huge impact on our business—and the world. Want in? About Us: As a global email provider, Yahoo Mail is the ultimate Consumer Inbox with over 220 million users. It is the best way to access your email and stay organized from a computer, phone or tablet. We develop technology that changes the internet while handling billions of inbound connections per day to manage trillions of messages requiring petabytes of efficient storage. The Yahoo Mail engineering team provides opportunities to work on challenges that are as exciting as the Yahoo Mail product itself at the scale that only a handful of companies can match. We are looking for innovative, entrepreneurial, and passionate developers to help us build the future of communications experiences and delight our users. We are engineers who strive to deliver our users only the absolute best and are willing to meticulously refine the details to achieve this goal. We believe that engineering is only a piece of the effort and that you must be as passionate about the user’s experience as you are about code quality and architecture. Our goal is to make communication simple, enjoyable and more productive to help our users run the business of life. About the team: Do you relish the opportunity to work on one of the largest distributed storage systems in the world, running on thousands of machines and handling petabytes of data? Developing this infrastructure requires solving many technical challenges in the areas of distributed computing frameworks, data structures and algorithms. The team is responsible to architect these platforms, build scalable and modular systems, measure and optimize system performance, and ensure that systems run reliably in a 24/7 production environment. Specifically, we work on a complete Java stack that serves hundreds of billions of transactions daily and will work on the complete redesign of the Mail Backend Storage System to make our system secure, highly available and durable. We also work on Next Gen solutions to reduce the hardware cost and Innovative algorithms to keep the user data in sync across multiple copies. Sounds Exciting? Then, come join us!! Responsibilities:  You will work on features or proof of concepts that are critical to the team. Collaborate with other engineers to write testable, reliable code, continuously deploying to production systems Responsible for writing excellent code and following best practices in software engineering. Deploy, monitor and operate large-scale production systems distributed across the globe.  Automate the provisioning, scaling, and management of our infrastructure A Lot About YOU You are passionate about growing your skills and value high quality engineering that can help modernize systems in the Cloud. You are interested in how best to drive tasks to completion, collaborate to achieve your goals, think through scenarios and edge cases, learn from your leadership (mentors), and understand the broader impact of your work. If you are interested in joining a world-class team of passionate people and industry veterans who like to work hard and play hard, we look forward to hearing from you soon! Qualifications: Strong Object Oriented programming languages such as Java, C++, or similar Strong understanding of computer science fundamentals including Data Structures, Algorithms, OS and Networking Understanding and experience with UNIX Knowledge of Perl, Python, or Shell scripting languages Ability to work well with diverse groups of people, geographically dispersed across the world Yahoo is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on age, race, gender, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability or any other protected category. title: Systems Engineer
description:
Qrypt builds quantum-secure encryption software and hardware in partnership with world-class national laboratories and academic institutions. We value protecting individual privacy and being transparent about the technology we use to enable it. The foundation of Qrypt technology is published by our experts in peer-reviewed scientific journals and supported by a growing portfolio of international patents. Qrypt’s product portfolio builds on these technologies to ensure enduring data security in the quantum age. Qrypt is looking for a  Systems Engineer  to join our growing team. The Systems Engineer will own the deployment, configuration, management, and monitoring of Qrypt's hardware infrastructure (servers, networking, power, and support). They will work with the Qrypt hardware and software team to translate product requirements into deployed infrastructure. This position is in Germantown, MD. Responsibilities Installing, configuring, testing, and maintaining operating systems, application software and system management tools Monitor deployed hardware and perform first-line triage and troubleshooting Develop a deep understanding of the system to be able to identify and resolve issues Identify hardware (server, networking, firewall, etc.) needs based on product team requirements (number of users, random generation, etc.) Develop and carry out processes to translate product requirements/system level requirements into actionable plans to identify, purchase, configure/assemble, and deploy required hardware Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in a technical field (Math, Physics, Engineering) and/or relevant work experience Expertise in the installation, upgrade, configuration, and performance tuning of Linux-based servers Understanding of networking concepts 4+ years of experience as a Systems Engineer, Site Reliability Engineer, Datacenter engineer, or equivalent Experience with configuration of L2 and L3 networking equipment Proficiency with bash and/or Python Strong written and verbal communication skills Ability to lift and carry up to 40 pounds Ability to install servers and networking equipment in a colo/datacenter environment Benefits & Perks Competitive Pay & Equity Paid Time Off Medical, dental & vision plan participation Strong 401K matching program Gym Reimbursement But above all, be part of an amazing team! Together, we’ll make this world a safer place About Qrypt Qrypt’s mission is to protect the world’s data. Ending encryption key transmission, the Qrypt Quantum Security suite hardens security and future-proofs encryption against quantum attacks. Qrypt’s unique technology independently generates one-time pads and symmetric keys at multiple endpoints, so that customers can eliminate key transmissions from critical workflows today. Qrypt's team of engineers, physicists, and cryptographers is committed to creating a new standard in security. Powered by JazzHR DfWjAxH9uw

title: Software Developer Intern
description:
It takes powerful technology to connect our brands and partners with an audience of nearly 900 million. Whether you’re looking to write mobile app code, engineer the servers behind our massive ad tech stacks, or develop algorithms to help us process trillions of data points a day, what you do here will have a huge impact on our business—and the world. Want in? A Little About Us Under the office of the CTO, the Yahoo Platforms Engineering (YPE) group enables all of the Yahoo verticals to develop and deliver the best possible products to our customers globally with the highest standards. Yahoo’s Platforms Engineering organization creates modern, secure, and efficient software platforms to power all of Yahoo’s brands at scale. The Yahoo Edge Engineering Group writes the code that runs Yahoo’s internal content delivery network (CDN). We develop the open source Apache Traffic Server as well as internal solutions for content caching, edge security, traffic shaping and routing, load balancing and failover, and IPv6 translation. Our code makes delivering Yahoo properties fast and reliable. We offer a variety of internships to students who want jobs with real responsibility, outstanding training, and the chance to learn from the best through 1:1 mentorship in a small team setting. As an intern, you will gain valuable work experience while developing your skills and establishing a track record to set you up for a potential full-time position after graduation. During the course of your internship, you will take part in an exciting lineup of intern events and engage in important projects that significantly impact the success of our businesses. At the end of your summer, you will have the opportunity to present your work to our leadership and network with our hiring managers. Your Day Design, develop, code and test software systems or applications for software improvements and new products; revise and refine as needed Develop project timelines, implement design specifications, system flow diagrams, documentation, testing, and ongoing support Recommend modifications to our processes and procedures Help us to identify a gold standard for current methodologies and implementations Make your voice heard by promoting your ideas within project teams Get involved in the intern outings, workshops, and trainings we have available Present your work to leadership and network with your fellow interns You Are An avid problem solver who has the capability to work independently as well as collaborate within a team Enrolled in a Bachelor's, Masters or Phd program in Computer Science or related major, and have a strong record of academic achievement Proficient in a language including one or many of the following: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node. title: Systems Engineer remote position
description:
Position Title: Systems Engineer 3 Position Location: remote Ability to work remote: Yes Remote details and time zone(s): 8-5PM EST Intended length of Assignment: 6 months before FTE consideration; 6 month extension if needed but NO visa candidates Potential for Contract Extension: Yes If yes, details (intended length of extension): 6 months Required Skills Strong Windows Desktop troubleshooting skills Experience using Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager and vulnerability remediation; Windows 10 20h2 (preferred but ANY version of Windows 10 is fine/required), Proficient in supporting Microsoft Defender for Endpoints using Microsoft Intune and MECM. title: IT Systems Engineer
description:
Position Summary/Objective The IT Systems Engineer is responsible for supporting the corporate office, market offices, and field-based staff in day-to-day use of their technology equipment. Equipment supported includes desktop computers, laptops, desk phone, cellular phones, tablets, printers, and other technology equipment. The role provides technical expertise to the desktop environment with a goal of increasing performance, reliability, usability, efficiency, and functionality of the computing environment. Typical duties include administering multiple systems for access control, packaging software for deployment, building/deploying desktop hardware and related software images, and utilizing group policy in a cloud-based domain structure for account administration. The IT Systems Engineer will use their skills and passion for technology to diagnose the most effective method to resolve problems and implement solutions that keep end user technology functional. Responsibilities also include the documentation of activities via support tickets, technology asset inventory, IT processes, policies, and procedures as necessary. Essential Duties And Responsibilities  This position will work with other IT team members to resolve help desk tickets, troubleshoot networking issues, support end user desktop and peripheral devices including phones, printers, tablets and smart phones  Additional duties include supporting the company servers, administering users within business applications, and maintaining run documentation for procedure manuals Minimum Qualifications  Bachelor's Degree in a related field or related professional experience; A+ and/or MCTS Certification  3-5 years of progressive experience in Information Technology Department with an emphasis on desktop support  Minimum 3 years customer service experience working with end users to troubleshoot and resolve end user technical problems  Technical knowledge and experience in Office 365, Windows 10, Active Directory, Group Policy, Application Repackaging, Apple IOS, PC Hardware Installation and Diagnosis, LAN I WAN Concepts (TCP IP, DHCP, DNS)  Build sustainable relationships of trust through open and interactive communication  Understanding of enterprise class networking equipment and concepts helpful  Ability to carry out assignments with minimum direction where objectives are broadly defined  Valid Driver's License is a requirement Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  S upervisory Responsibility  None  T ravel  This position may require travel to market offices as necessary to deploy technology equipment . Other Duties Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. We recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of the job. title: Vice President, System Operations and Infrastructure
description:
As VP of Systems Operations & Infrastructure for Raintree Systems, you will lead all aspects of System Operations, Infrastructure, Enterprise Technology (aka IT), and Security for all customer-facing and internal applications. This position is responsible for driving improvements, innovation, automation and efficiencies for Cloud Platforms, SaaS, SSO, SecOps, ISO27001 Compliance, Service Level, and Performance Management. You will partner with company leadership to ensure appropriate people, talent, strategy, and processes are in place to support the company's strategic and operational initiatives. This position will also act as Raintree’s Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) ensuring comprehensive electronic health care PHI-related security and compliance. As the company’s CISO you will be responsible for the planning, development, and execution of Raintree’s enterprise information security strategy and best practices approach in support of Raintree’s information security architecture. In this role, you will work collaboratively across the organization to identify, develop, implement, and maintain processes and best practices across the organization to reduce information and information technology risks and will report timely and regularly to Executive management. This position is remote from one of the designated states below. Responsibilities Lead the Infrastructure, System Operations, Security and Desktop Support teams for all products and systems in the company. Establish technology and security vision and goals. Build/enhance effective systems and platforms that meet stakeholder requirements Act as Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) to keep our platforms secure from internal and external threats  Manage the budgets, including build, buy, or partner decisions and manage our cloud and capital costs to industry standards. Analyze the costs, value, and risks of technology to advise executive leaders and drive investments Establish service level agreements (SLAs) that meet business needs, and monitor performance to ensure adherence to commitments Implement technology and optimizations to streamline operations and security. Monitor changes or advancements in technology to discover ways to gain a competitive advantage  Partner effectively with all levels of the organization to identify, prioritize, and drive strategic initiatives that impact the organization. Communicate strategy, objectives, and performance results to the executive team and cross-functional partners Abilities & Knowledge Cloud - AWS ISO27001 Security Governance & Compliance Broad knowledge of IT disciplines, most important system administration, information security, and DevOps Strong leadership presence Track record building, leading and mentoring high-performing technical teams Significant experience working and leading cross-functionally in high growth organizations Outstanding written and verbal communication skills; proven ability to communicate effectively at C-level and Board of Directors Knowledge of Microsoft and Google product suites Education and Experience Bachelor's degree in a related field Minimum 10 years of work experience in the technology industry required 7+ years technology leadership experience in high-tech companies, preferably with SaaS business models Must reside in one of the following states: AZ, CA, CO, CT, FL, GA, ID, IL, IN, KS, MA, MI, MO, MS, NC, NJ, NV, OR, PA, SC, TN, TX, UT, VA, WA Raintree Systems provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. We carry out our mission through applied science and research that enhance practical natural technologies for the agriculture and aquaculture industries. In a world filled with technology that people mistrust, creative thinking has driven Ralco to provide trusted alternatives. Our technologies come to life through products in our Ralco brands: Ralco Nutrition, Strong Animals®, Agnition®, trū® Shrimp and Ralco Show.  OUR MISSION:  Steward our God-given gifts to perfect technologies that enhance the vitality of plants and animals for a safe and abundant food supply.  OUR VALUES:  We do what is right We serve others and help them succeed We believe in hard work and a commitment to family We treat others with dignity and respect JOB SUMMARY: As Systems Developer, you are charged with utilizing technology to solve complex business problems that will increase sales, improve our customers experience, increase efficiencies, and help differentiate us from our competitors. You must possess a blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. You must be a seasoned developer who understands technology broadly, loves to learn new technologies and enjoys new technical challenges. You must be able to communicate well with the broader IT team and provide technical leadership as you help us translate business strategy into systems to support that strategy. KEY WORK DUTIES AND REQUIRED SKILLS: Design and development of new systems as well as maintenance and enhancement of existing systems.  Implementation, testing, debugging and deployment of software systems. Work with business analyst, external technical resources and end-users as required for design and implementation of new systems and trouble-shooting problems with existing systems. Serving as team lead on projects and. Ensure productivity of end-users through their use of software and computer systems and related support. Ensure our systems are reliable and secure to meet our growing business needs.  Measuring and tracking performance of systems and preparing reports to keep management informed of needs and risks. Mentoring and supporting more junior members of the systems development staff. Proactively learn and utilize new technologies, concepts and procedures as appropriate to ensure we are staying current with technology advancements. Other duties as assigned. JOB REQUIREMENTS:  Education:   Undergraduate degree in computer science, management information systems or related field required.  Experience:  5+ years development experience preferred, including .NET using C# and web services.  Physical:   The following activities are required as needed to perform the job function: lifting, driving, bending, climbing, carrying and twisting. Confined space entry is not a required job function. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the key work duties.  Travel:   This position requires minimal travel to customer and non-customer sites.  Location:   This position will be based in the Ralco Headquarters in Marshall, MN. Benefits Competitive pay based on previous experience. title: IT Systems Administrator
description:
Corrigan Oil - Who We Are:  Corrigan Oil is an equal employment opportunity employer with a dedication to customer satisfaction and quality that is second to none. Corrigan Oil is a family-owned business offering long-term career opportunities and a culture where you will be treated with respect and proud to work within. Corrigan Oil has expanded into a family of companies including:  Corrigan Oil, Construction, 24-hour Towing, Lubricants, Transportation, Propane, Mechanical Contractors, Environmental Solutions, Technical Environmental Services and Blue Water Industrial Products. Corrigan Oil understands the importance of preserving our environment and giving back to the communities. At Corrigan, we are proud supporters of our communities and encourage our employees to be active leaders, mentors, and volunteers.  Why Join the Corrigan Team:  Corrigan is a large company that operates with a small feel. Our culture is best described as hard working and ambitious. We are constantly looking for opportunities to say “yes we can” with a goal of total customer satisfaction while providing our products and services safely. Corrigan is a fast moving, quickly growing company that empowers our employees to be the best they can be with room for advancement throughout all branches of the organization.  Benefits:  Corrigan Oil offers a comprehensive benefits package to help you stay well, protect yourself and your family, and plan for a secure future. Benefits include: Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance. Life Insurance. Short-Term Disability coverage Vacation & Personal Time 401(k) – Company matches 50% up to 5% employee income  Job Overview:  The primary function of the IT Systems Administrator is to administer the installation, configuration and maintenance of physical\virtual infrastructure equipment and software. This includes Network Routers/Switches, WAN Links, Firewalls, Mail Filters: Application/File Servers; Mail/Messaging Servers; and Cloud Services. This position will work with a high level of independence requiring excellent prioritization skills, as well as the ability to efficiently evaluate and escalate support calls when necessary. This position will assist the IT Manager in regular functions and on special projects as requested. Duties vary and are assigned based on knowledge and skills.  Essential Job Functions:  Administration and support computer IT environments, which includes but is not limited, to implementing system configuration, determining hardware, software and system functional specifications, and performing system installation. Administer the installation, operation, maintenance, and upgrades of hardware and software systems required. This includes the WAN (Wide Area Networks), LAN (Local Area Networks), VMware, Linux/Unix, MS Windows Servers, and data storage/SAN (Storage Area Network) and NAS (Network Attached Storage) environments. Configures and maintains physical / virtual servers, internal / cloud applications, end user computers, security, disaster recovery solutions, and network design and implementation. Implementation and management of system back-up, restoration and controlling protocols/procedures. Make recommendations regarding systems or procedural improvements, including recommendations regarding existing and/or new equipment, networking technology (such as network hardware, switches, routers, firewalls), security appliances, or software / cloud solutions. Establishes and administers the monitoring, measuring, and evaluating of hardware, software and network capacity performance reporting results to external clients. Manages user accounts, permissions, email, anti-virus, anti-spam and installs security programs to prevent unauthorized access to privileged data and information. Provide regular structured IT support and maintenance relating to issues with infrastructure leveraging the client Services’ standards and procedures. Performs intermediate level troubleshooting analysis of servers, workstations, and associated systems. Troubleshoots malfunctions of network hardware and software applications, to resolve operational issues and documents network problems and resolutions. Actively contribute to development of applicable IT standards and procedures. Manages and aids in project plan development and execution for server and network infrastructure upgrades. Installation, configuration, and support for PCs and PC related peripherals, network routers/switches, and printers. Escalate service or project issues that cannot be completed within agreed service levels. Travel to various company locations as required. Complete on-call responsibilities as required. Assist in the development of strong client relationships through constant dedication to client service and encouraging open lines of communication. Review IT publications and online materials to remain up to date with current and future technologies emerging in the industry.  Qualifications / Experience / Education:   Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Information Systems (or related degree/equivalent combination of work experience) is required. 2-4 years of administrative support experience with an emphasis on Windows Server 2016/2012/2008 computing environments (Windows File Servers and PCs) supporting an organization of 50+ users. MCSE certification a plus. Experience with Unix/Linux, UNIX certification(s) desirable. Intermediate knowledge and experience in the area LAN and WAN inclusive of DNS, DHCP, IP addressing, etc. Entry to intermediate level knowledge of hardware imaging applications and deployment tools. (MS WDS, MS MDT, Acronis) Multiple Professional IT Certifications, such as: Microsoft MCP, MCSA, or MCSE; WatchGuard; Cisco CCNA; CompTIA; or VMware VCP. Interpersonal skills: Professional verbal and written communication skills, active listening, and client-care. Ability to effectively communicate to a diverse group of directors, managers, vendors, clients, and personnel at all levels. Technical awareness: ability to match resources to technical issues appropriately. Professional in appearance and approach; exudes expertise and credibility. Sound tactical thinker: ability to identify opportunities; initiator of improvements. Robust problem solving, analytical and listening skills. Ability to excel in a fast-paced, dynamic organization. Superior time management skills and demonstrated ability to multi-task on various work activities. Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office to include Word, Excel, Visio and Power Point. Good verbal, written, presentation and problem-solving skills. Demonstrates the ability to work as part of a team and has a clear understanding of how assigned responsibilities impact other processes and the work of other people. Possess a “positive can-do” attitude. Highly self-motivated to work independently, within delegated authority, with minimal supervision. May sit at desk for long periods of time; frequently answer telephone and write or use a keyboard to communicate through written means. Some lifting to 50 lbs. may be required. Network Engineer: 2 years (Preferred). System Administration: 2 years (Preferred). Able to pass 7-year background check. #INDAOJ Powered by JazzHR lBL2j8ei0O

title: Help Desk Manager
description:
HELP DESK MANAGER – NYC/HQ   Recycle Track Systems - Equal Opportunity Employer: B Corporation  Recycle Track Systems is a leading provider of comprehensive environmental and waste management solutions services in North America. We invest in our client’s success by providing state-of-the-art technology, processes, and the best leadership in the industry. We are educators and leaders, with a passion for helping businesses become more sustainable and using our proprietary technology to make our service exceptional. We provide waste management, recycling, sustainability solutions for across businesses verticals Recycle Track Systems (RTS) has ushered in a new era for waste and recycling solutions, through the use of data analytics and technology service offerings. RTS proprietary tracking system empowers both customers and waste haulers by providing real time data and analytics increasing efficiency and surfacing greater insight into waste and recycling service pickups. Headquartered in New York City, Recycle Track Systems team of sustainability analysts, waste experts, and technologists remove inefficiencies in the waste management and recycling chain, creating an enhanced experience for customers and haulers.    About the Role Recycle Track system is looking for an experienced hands-on help desk manager to oversee our desktop support team in providing exemplary technical support to our end-users. The manager will manage an outsourced vendor and two help desk support engineers in different locations. This is a full-time onsite role based in our New York city headquarters location. Candidates are expected to be in the office during regular business hours. To be successful as a help desk manager, you should have excellent customer service and conflict management skills. Ultimately, a top-notch help desk manager should be able to ensure that our users receive professional and efficient technical support. The ideal candidate has strong communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to prioritize tasks with a problem-solving attitude.  What You’ll Do To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned. Managing outsourced partners and SLAs. Maintain and upgrade network operations, help desk, and monitoring systems. Provides clients with technical services for laptops, workstations, peripherals, remote computing, applications, communications, Office 365, and internet solutions. Knowledge of cloud technologies like Azure, and AWS is preferable. Managing and supporting a team of helpdesk support engineers. Properly identify changes, make recommendations and implement technical solutions. Mentor team members, providing training and conducting performance evaluations. Monitoring team and vendor performance and developing feedback reports for management. Conduct monthly stakeholder meetings to review SLA and obtain feedback. Communicating with users and providing in-person and phone support, if required. Troubleshooting and resolving technical issues. Managing escalations and ensuring any issues are resolved promptly. Making recommendations to improve operational efficiency. Procurement of IT hardware and software, including renewals Define Cyber Security Policy, Practices and Procedures, implement application- CASB, MFA tools, security apps and monitoring of threats. Investigate security reaches and other cyber security incidents. Implement IT ad-hoc projects and improvement initiatives Management of IT assets including mobile devices, VOIP infrastructure for the organization Provide required access to managed service vendor for technologies such as Citrix, VPN, Cisco/Meraki firewall & switch, Cisco Meraki MDM or Virtual Desktop Troubleshooting system and network problems and diagnosing and solving hardware and software faults, replacing parts as required. Be Available to provide after-hours support to all urgent and emergency requests. What We’re Looking For Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field. Ability to work well independently as well as take ownership of assigned tasks to completion At least two years of experience as a Help Desk Manager with 5 years in technical support role. Understanding and hands-on experience with Cloud computing, virtualization technologies and Office 365 Good project management, organizational and time management skills to handle multiple projects simultaneously. Excellent customer service and communication skills (verbal and written) to effectively engage with clients. ERP experience, preferably with Microsoft Dynamics applications Strong technical background. Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills. Ability to work under pressure. Excellent leadership and people management skills. Strong customer service skills. A self-starter with the ability to work independently under minimal supervision. Benefits RTS provides a competitive total compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, 401(k) savings, and Short-Term Disability. Our employees also receive paid vacation, holidays, and volunteer days. Please note that benefits may vary and are subject to change.

Does working with Python, Apache Spark, Apache Cassandra, Apache Pulsar, CockroachDB and other current Big Data technologies sound exciting to you? iland’s Junior Data Engineer will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross-functional teams. This person will support our software developers, database architects, and data analysts on data initiatives and will ensure optimal delivery and consistent architecture throughout ongoing projects. Join our global team of software developers as a Junior Data Engineer and contribute to development of the industry-leading 11:11 Cloud Console (https://1111systems.com/why-1111/cloud-console ), among other exciting projects. This is only the beginning of what will surely be your most challenging and rewarding role to date. Work with the latest technologies and push the barriers, all while helping build dynamic software that will have a lasting effect on the industry. Responsibilities Take an idea from design concept to working implementation that will be deployed for both internal and external use Build elegant, clean, bulletproof code that is driven by tests Work with Software Engineering to ensure architectural and implementation coherence Debug issues and develop quick, robust solutions to keep systems running smoothly Participate in code reviews to ensure alignment with the architectural approach and to maintain a clean code base Requirements   Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent Strong interpersonal and communication skills is essential Flexibility, energy, and ability to work well with others in a team environment Must have skills include: 1+ years of Python experience 1+ year(s) of Data Engineering experience Strong Understanding of SQL and NoSQL databases Git CI/CD Linux Nice to have skills include: Experience with Apache Spark or other DataFrame-like frameworks Experience with Apache Cassandra Open-source project contributions GitHub or public-facing source code Developer forum (Stack Overflow, etc.) participation Benefits Competitive Salary 401k Plan with Company Match PPO Healthcare Insurance Plan Dental Insurance Vision Insurance Life Insurance Paid Vacation & Holidays About 11:11 Systems 11:11 Systems was created to deliver a fully integrated and unified network experience, providing our customers with visibility, control, and decision making to simplify their requirements through one experience: simplified, synchronized, and optimized. 11:11 is invested in creating a new model empowering its customers and partners to “RETHINK CONNECTED”. May sit at desk for long periods of time; frequently answer telephone and write or use a keyboard to communicate through written means. Some lifting to 50 lbs. may be required. title: Help Desk Manager
description:
HELP DESK MANAGER – NYC/HQ   Recycle Track Systems - Equal Opportunity Employer: B Corporation  Recycle Track Systems is a leading provider of comprehensive environmental and waste management solutions services in North America. We invest in our client’s success by providing state-of-the-art technology, processes, and the best leadership in the industry. We are educators and leaders, with a passion for helping businesses become more sustainable and using our proprietary technology to make our service exceptional. We provide waste management, recycling, sustainability solutions for across businesses verticals Recycle Track Systems (RTS) has ushered in a new era for waste and recycling solutions, through the use of data analytics and technology service offerings. RTS proprietary tracking system empowers both customers and waste haulers by providing real time data and analytics increasing efficiency and surfacing greater insight into waste and recycling service pickups. Headquartered in New York City, Recycle Track Systems team of sustainability analysts, waste experts, and technologists remove inefficiencies in the waste management and recycling chain, creating an enhanced experience for customers and haulers.    About the Role Recycle Track system is looking for an experienced hands-on help desk manager to oversee our desktop support team in providing exemplary technical support to our end-users. The manager will manage an outsourced vendor and two help desk support engineers in different locations. This is a full-time onsite role based in our New York city headquarters location. Candidates are expected to be in the office during regular business hours. To be successful as a help desk manager, you should have excellent customer service and conflict management skills. Ultimately, a top-notch help desk manager should be able to ensure that our users receive professional and efficient technical support. The ideal candidate has strong communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to prioritize tasks with a problem-solving attitude.  What You’ll Do To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned. Managing outsourced partners and SLAs. Maintain and upgrade network operations, help desk, and monitoring systems. Provides clients with technical services for laptops, workstations, peripherals, remote computing, applications, communications, Office 365, and internet solutions. Knowledge of cloud technologies like Azure, and AWS is preferable. Managing and supporting a team of helpdesk support engineers. Properly identify changes, make recommendations and implement technical solutions. Mentor team members, providing training and conducting performance evaluations. Monitoring team and vendor performance and developing feedback reports for management. Conduct monthly stakeholder meetings to review SLA and obtain feedback. Communicating with users and providing in-person and phone support, if required. Troubleshooting and resolving technical issues. Managing escalations and ensuring any issues are resolved promptly. Making recommendations to improve operational efficiency. Procurement of IT hardware and software, including renewals Define Cyber Security Policy, Practices and Procedures, implement application- CASB, MFA tools, security apps and monitoring of threats. Investigate security reaches and other cyber security incidents. Implement IT ad-hoc projects and improvement initiatives Management of IT assets including mobile devices, VOIP infrastructure for the organization Provide required access to managed service vendor for technologies such as Citrix, VPN, Cisco/Meraki firewall & switch, Cisco Meraki MDM or Virtual Desktop Troubleshooting system and network problems and diagnosing and solving hardware and software faults, replacing parts as required. Be Available to provide after-hours support to all urgent and emergency requests. What We’re Looking For Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field. Ability to work well independently as well as take ownership of assigned tasks to completion At least two years of experience as a Help Desk Manager with 5 years in technical support role. Understanding and hands-on experience with Cloud computing, virtualization technologies and Office 365 Good project management, organizational and time management skills to handle multiple projects simultaneously. Excellent customer service and communication skills (verbal and written) to effectively engage with clients. ERP experience, preferably with Microsoft Dynamics applications Strong technical background. Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills. Ability to work under pressure. Excellent leadership and people management skills. Strong customer service skills. A self-starter with the ability to work independently under minimal supervision. Benefits RTS provides a competitive total compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, 401(k) savings, and Short-Term Disability. Our employees also receive paid vacation, holidays, and volunteer days. Please note that benefits may vary and are subject to change.

title: Software Engineer I (Intern) United States
description:
What You’ll Do Our software engineers are the gurus behind the scenes ensuring our all of our programs are easy to use and bug free. Using a keen eye, you’ll develop software and tools in support of many of our high-impact technology platforms such as operating systems, networks, databases and more. While we’re growing in the software business, you’ll still need to see the big picture and watch for hardware compatibility while even potentially influencing design. Who You’ll Work With Our hardworking team members are busy programming magic across the globe on teams such as Engineering, Information Technology, Supply Chain, Customer Experience, Security and Trust, etc. You would play a crucial role in driving next-gen software innovations including cloud, mobile, desktop or security spaces. On any of these teams, you'll get hands-on experience working with applications that make technology accessible no matter what device they’re on. See the possibilities when creativity meets design and build solutions which will transform how we work, live, learn, and play. Who You Are  Including but not limited to an upcoming graduate of a technical degree or certification program from a Technical Boot Camp, Apprenticeship, Community College or 4-Year University.   Up-to-date on programming and scripting languages: C/C++, Python, Java   Knowledge of Linux, Networking concepts, OS fundamentals, Embedded Development, and/or ML   Hands on QA, Testing, and/or Debugging skills   Experience with Databases, Web Application Development, and Web Services   Able to legally live and work in the country for which you’re applying, without visa support or sponsorship  Why Cisco #WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all. We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box! But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.) Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward. So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

title: Software Engineering Intern
description:
It takes powerful technology to connect our brands and partners with an audience of nearly 900 million. Whether you’re looking to write mobile app code, engineer the servers behind our massive ad tech stacks, or develop algorithms to help us process trillions of data points a day, what you do here will have a huge impact on our business—and the world. Want in? About Us: As a global email provider, Yahoo Mail is the ultimate Consumer Inbox with over 220 million users. It is the best way to access your email and stay organized from a computer, phone or tablet. We develop technology that changes the internet while handling billions of inbound connections per day to manage trillions of messages requiring petabytes of efficient storage. The Yahoo Mail engineering team provides opportunities to work on challenges that are as exciting as the Yahoo Mail product itself at the scale that only a handful of companies can match. We are looking for innovative, entrepreneurial, and passionate developers to help us build the future of communications experiences and delight our users. We are engineers who strive to deliver our users only the absolute best and are willing to meticulously refine the details to achieve this goal. We believe that engineering is only a piece of the effort and that you must be as passionate about the user’s experience as you are about code quality and architecture. Our goal is to make communication simple, enjoyable and more productive to help our users run the business of life. About the team: Do you relish the opportunity to work on one of the largest distributed storage systems in the world, running on thousands of machines and handling petabytes of data? Developing this infrastructure requires solving many technical challenges in the areas of distributed computing frameworks, data structures and algorithms. The team is responsible to architect these platforms, build scalable and modular systems, measure and optimize system performance, and ensure that systems run reliably in a 24/7 production environment. Specifically, we work on a complete Java stack that serves hundreds of billions of transactions daily and will work on the complete redesign of the Mail Backend Storage System to make our system secure, highly available and durable. We also work on Next Gen solutions to reduce the hardware cost and Innovative algorithms to keep the user data in sync across multiple copies. Sounds Exciting? Then, come join us!! Responsibilities:  You will work on features or proof of concepts that are critical to the team. Collaborate with other engineers to write testable, reliable code, continuously deploying to production systems Responsible for writing excellent code and following best practices in software engineering. Deploy, monitor and operate large-scale production systems distributed across the globe.  Automate the provisioning, scaling, and management of our infrastructure A Lot About YOU You are passionate about growing your skills and value high quality engineering that can help modernize systems in the Cloud. You are interested in how best to drive tasks to completion, collaborate to achieve your goals, think through scenarios and edge cases, learn from your leadership (mentors), and understand the broader impact of your work. If you are interested in joining a world-class team of passionate people and industry veterans who like to work hard and play hard, we look forward to hearing from you soon! Qualifications: Strong Object Oriented programming languages such as Java, C++, or similar Strong understanding of computer science fundamentals including Data Structures, Algorithms, OS and Networking Understanding and experience with UNIX Knowledge of Perl, Python, or Shell scripting languages Ability to work well with diverse groups of people, geographically dispersed across the world Yahoo is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Yahoo’s Platforms Engineering organization creates modern, secure, and efficient software platforms to power all of Yahoo’s brands at scale. To do all this, we work with technologies such as Vespa (Vespa.ai), Redis, Cassandra, Storm, Kafka, Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Spark, and gRPC. title: IT Systems Engineer
description:
Position Summary/Objective The IT Systems Engineer is responsible for supporting the corporate office, market offices, and field-based staff in day-to-day use of their technology equipment. Equipment supported includes desktop computers, laptops, desk phone, cellular phones, tablets, printers, and other technology equipment. The role provides technical expertise to the desktop environment with a goal of increasing performance, reliability, usability, efficiency, and functionality of the computing environment. Typical duties include administering multiple systems for access control, packaging software for deployment, building/deploying desktop hardware and related software images, and utilizing group policy in a cloud-based domain structure for account administration. The IT Systems Engineer will use their skills and passion for technology to diagnose the most effective method to resolve problems and implement solutions that keep end user technology functional. Responsibilities also include the documentation of activities via support tickets, technology asset inventory, IT processes, policies, and procedures as necessary. Essential Duties And Responsibilities  This position will work with other IT team members to resolve help desk tickets, troubleshoot networking issues, support end user desktop and peripheral devices including phones, printers, tablets and smart phones  Additional duties include supporting the company servers, administering users within business applications, and maintaining run documentation for procedure manuals Minimum Qualifications  Bachelor's Degree in a related field or related professional experience; A+ and/or MCTS Certification  3-5 years of progressive experience in Information Technology Department with an emphasis on desktop support  Minimum 3 years customer service experience working with end users to troubleshoot and resolve end user technical problems  Technical knowledge and experience in Office 365, Windows 10, Active Directory, Group Policy, Application Repackaging, Apple IOS, PC Hardware Installation and Diagnosis, LAN I WAN Concepts (TCP IP, DHCP, DNS)  Build sustainable relationships of trust through open and interactive communication  Understanding of enterprise class networking equipment and concepts helpful  Ability to carry out assignments with minimum direction where objectives are broadly defined  Valid Driver's License is a requirement Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  S upervisory Responsibility  None  T ravel  This position may require travel to market offices as necessary to deploy technology equipment . Other Duties Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. We recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of the job. If your experience is close to what you see listed here, please still consider applying. Diversity of experience and skills combined with passion is a key to innovation and excellence; therefore, we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the interview process. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants shall be considered for all positions without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by federal, state or local law. title: Vice President, System Operations and Infrastructure
description:
As VP of Systems Operations & Infrastructure for Raintree Systems, you will lead all aspects of System Operations, Infrastructure, Enterprise Technology (aka IT), and Security for all customer-facing and internal applications. This position is responsible for driving improvements, innovation, automation and efficiencies for Cloud Platforms, SaaS, SSO, SecOps, ISO27001 Compliance, Service Level, and Performance Management. You will partner with company leadership to ensure appropriate people, talent, strategy, and processes are in place to support the company's strategic and operational initiatives. This position will also act as Raintree’s Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) ensuring comprehensive electronic health care PHI-related security and compliance. As the company’s CISO you will be responsible for the planning, development, and execution of Raintree’s enterprise information security strategy and best practices approach in support of Raintree’s information security architecture. In this role, you will work collaboratively across the organization to identify, develop, implement, and maintain processes and best practices across the organization to reduce information and information technology risks and will report timely and regularly to Executive management. This position is remote from one of the designated states below. title: Software Dev Engineering Intern
description:
It takes powerful technology to connect our brands and partners with an audience of nearly 900 million. Whether you’re looking to write mobile app code, engineer the servers behind our massive ad tech stacks, or develop algorithms to help us process trillions of data points a day, what you do here will have a huge impact on our business—and the world. Want in? The Location Platforms team is responsible for all services related to the processing and serving of location centric entities, predicting and processing user location, and the contextual intersection of these two spaces ­including: geo­political relationship mapping, forward and reverse geo­coding and routing, point­-of-­interest catalog and search, movement data contextual enrichment, etc. These services are embedded across the footprint of the Yahoo Media network in applications like Web Search, Ads Targeting, Content Personalization, Mail Inbox Commerce, etc, while also producing aggregate data for campaign insights and business intelligence. In support of these goals, the Location team builds highly scalable back­-office and front­-stage systems backed by both statistical and machine­-learned models that have access to large scale data from user activities and interactions. This requires Software Engineers skilled in the disciplines of big­-data manipulation using distributed computing technologies, data mining, statistical analysis, machine-­learned modelling, and the domain knowledge to support these models with appropriate feature engineering activities. Responsibilities : Design, develop, code and test software systems or applications for software improvements and new products; revise and refine as needed. Data mine and aggregate captured user activities. Construct ad hoc studies, data visualizations, and analytic tools.  Implement workflows to enrich user activities based on Spatio-temporal behaviors. Identify and execute feature extraction and engineering opportunities related to supervised and unsupervised models.  Work side­-by-­side with other engineers to train, evaluate and launch machine-learned ranking and classification models ­deployed in back-end workflows. Adhere to coding and documentation standards, conduct code reviews, and be a fully participating member of the engineering team and its practices. title: Systems Engineer
description:
Qrypt builds quantum-secure encryption software and hardware in partnership with world-class national laboratories and academic institutions. We value protecting individual privacy and being transparent about the technology we use to enable it. The foundation of Qrypt technology is published by our experts in peer-reviewed scientific journals and supported by a growing portfolio of international patents. Qrypt’s product portfolio builds on these technologies to ensure enduring data security in the quantum age. Qrypt is looking for a  Systems Engineer  to join our growing team. The Systems Engineer will own the deployment, configuration, management, and monitoring of Qrypt's hardware infrastructure (servers, networking, power, and support). They will work with the Qrypt hardware and software team to translate product requirements into deployed infrastructure. This position is in Germantown, MD. Responsibilities Installing, configuring, testing, and maintaining operating systems, application software and system management tools Monitor deployed hardware and perform first-line triage and troubleshooting Develop a deep understanding of the system to be able to identify and resolve issues Identify hardware (server, networking, firewall, etc.) needs based on product team requirements (number of users, random generation, etc.) Develop and carry out processes to translate product requirements/system level requirements into actionable plans to identify, purchase, configure/assemble, and deploy required hardware Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in a technical field (Math, Physics, Engineering) and/or relevant work experience Expertise in the installation, upgrade, configuration, and performance tuning of Linux-based servers Understanding of networking concepts 4+ years of experience as a Systems Engineer, Site Reliability Engineer, Datacenter engineer, or equivalent Experience with configuration of L2 and L3 networking equipment Proficiency with bash and/or Python Strong written and verbal communication skills Ability to lift and carry up to 40 pounds Ability to install servers and networking equipment in a colo/datacenter environment Benefits & Perks Competitive Pay & Equity Paid Time Off Medical, dental & vision plan participation Strong 401K matching program Gym Reimbursement But above all, be part of an amazing team! Together, we’ll make this world a safer place About Qrypt Qrypt’s mission is to protect the world’s data. Ending encryption key transmission, the Qrypt Quantum Security suite hardens security and future-proofs encryption against quantum attacks. Qrypt’s unique technology independently generates one-time pads and symmetric keys at multiple endpoints, so that customers can eliminate key transmissions from critical workflows today. Qrypt's team of engineers, physicists, and cryptographers is committed to creating a new standard in security. Powered by JazzHR DfWjAxH9uw
